Summary: Great location, right across from John Wayne Airport (JWA). If the season was right, the beach is 10-15 minutes away. Ample restaurants nearby. The property was clean and up to date. Would definitely like to stay again sometime

Good place,  Hotel easy to find, perfect to rest, very quiet, good food, comfortable beds, clean and sanitized rooms, good price, jacuzzy, pool, tv, internet, very friendly staff, close to move to many places.

Summary Heading: Avoid this nasty, gross, unsafe hotel.
Summary: Please avoid this place. It is nasty, gross, disgusting, and unsafe. What a terrible place to even try to stay at for  even a night. The room that was supposed to be a non-smoking room smelled badly and dirty with smoke residue. The carpet had huge stains as if someone had either vomited or pissed on it. The mattress was old, and the sheets did not look clean and were very thin. You walk around the property, you see trash and people smoking from their non-smoking rooms. There were people loitering around the property and you could tell there was suspicious activity going on with cars and people constantly coming in and out. There was even a sketchy guy circling the property on a bike for whatever reason. I was surprised how much of a dump this place was especially since it is

Summary Heading: Dirty hotel that ran by amateurs. Stay far away from this place
Summary: First off they gave me a room that had someone inside. No soap at all, dirty room, broken bed, and kids at the front office. The only reason people like this place is because it's cheap and close to John Wayne Airport but that's about it.

Summary Heading: One of the worst properties I have ever stayed at.
Summary: First with the check in. I booked two rooms but their were two different guests and the front desk charged me for both. Not a huge problem since my friend reimbursed me. However, the bed was extremely uncomfortable, the sheets were sticky, some of the outlets failed to work, the TV remote would not change volume or channels, other guests had laundry hanging on the windows making the entire place feel like a ghetto. My friend complained about noise almost all night until past 3AM. The "Breakfast" was extremely lacking and the coffee was...well how the heck does someone mess up coffee? Lastly a trailer with old mattresses parked out front? Really?

Summary Heading: Outdated but ok for the price
Summary: The room was large but felt as if it was under renovation with half assembled pieces of furniture. We slept ok. Everything worked well and it was good to have a microwave and coffee maker in the room. The breakfast was subpar, definitely. Another issue was with the cleaning of the room. The first day we put up the sign that there was no need to clean the room. And it wasn’t cleaned. Good. Next day we did not put up the sign because we wanted it cleaned. It wasn’t. We were then told that to get the room cleaned we had to alert the reception. Which we then did. The third day we left early and came back late, and the room was yet again not cleaned. Perhaps they are understaffed on cleaners or they give priority to rooms checked out to make them ready for new guests, but it got

Good value for the area, I guess, check in was pleasant and informative. Rooms were clean and beds were comfortable. Lots of parking and easy access to the city. Don't like that the deposit was large and takes far to long to be returned... 5 working days! A gas station can return a deposit in 5 minutes what can't these hotels!

People say that you get what you pay for. Not in this case. Even though this hotel is relatively cheap, at $125 per night by the time we stayed there, you get a very bad experience. Hotel rooms are worn out and smelly. Ours, in a non-smoking section, smelled like an ash tray. Carpet was dirty, bath tub fixtures were rusty. Bad. Pretty bad. We reserved for 2 nights but stayed just one. Not anymore.

This is not a 5 star hotel but it worked for us. The room was clean it had AC and had a little safe which was nice. They might want to clean up the mattress and shelves in the back as it does not look the best.

Summary Heading: Wish I would have read reviews
Summary: I'm a frequent traveler to this area and this hotel should not be associated with Wyndham. It is dated, dirty, not maintained and pretty sketchy. I stayed 5 hours before an early flight and that was enough. It must have changed owners recently as the prior reviews were better. Go elsewhere!

I felt like the pictures posted on their page were highly deceptive. Not nearly as "clean" looking. Lobby was very musty smelling. When I gave my name they said I had reserved a smoking room. I said no, and she said that was what they had. I checked my receipt, and that's what it said, but I never reserve smoking. Then a man came in to check in and they did the same thing to him. I wanted to leave, but my room was already paid, and I knew I wouldn't get my money back. Took me a half hour to get my room because they were waiting for a clean room at three in the afternoon. Room itself had a table lamp, an overhead dome light fixture with one functional bulb, and no other light except the one over the sink. There were sconces on either side of the bed, but no lights. I tried to

The room was dirty.  The carpet was sticky. Wore flip flops so my feet would not get dirty from walking on it. Sink was either super hot or cold. No way to make the water warm.  In the morning I saw a cockroach walk out of my bag!  I wish I would have seen it the night before. We would have left the hotel.

Hotel is very close to Orange County airport, therefore early morning noise from aircraft! Breakfast room not large enough and on one morning very little food was available due to food delivery problem!! We had noise from both rooms either side of us! The jacuzzi was filthy! We only got room service on one of the four days we stayed and had to ask on numerous occasions for new towel! Room looked very dated, but the hotel was in the process of replacing furniture! Internet was extremely slow and unusable!

Since I can’t read a negative number I figured I’d go with terrible. My advice DONT STAY HERE! I have plenty of pictures to show all the things experienced. So first issue when I went to check in I was told I’d be placed in a smoking room which I’m not a smoker I said no I needed non-smoking so the two soft members went back-and-forth on what room they can put me in. Finally deciding on room 109 when I got to the room I noticed as soon as I open the door there was a horrible strong smell of mildew. Thought okay nothing Lysol can’t handle I went inside instantly noticed there was bugs on the bottom of the bed not even bothering to pull the sheets down to look.. I didn’t notice to the bathroom there was some little like devices left on the counter that I’m assuming belong to

This place is a little outdated in looks and amenities. If you simply want the basic needs met while on a business trip or short turnaround, where you won't spend much time in your room, this may be an option.

We came here and there was a line for almost an hour waiting on the one employee who seemed like he didn’t want to be there. Then by the time we finally got to our room there was a hole in the wall, it was stinky and worst of all it had no towels. When we went to the desk back to the grumpy employee he said that they were washing and he would deliver them when they were done. We never got any towels that night or the next morning.

Room smelled like smoke even tho it was supposed to be a non-smoking room and property. People were smoking on property. Dirty furniture in room, carpet was old and stained, broken picture frame on wall, only 1 light in bathroom instead of 4 in fixture. Breakfast bare minimum

Room was smelly of weed and the carpet was filthy…it was BLACK of how dirty it was! People in the next room where loud at night. Group of guys hanging out in the parking lot smoking weed and drinking .

Part business part pleasure this property is excellent no matter your travel needs. These people care! The breakfast, staff and security make my trip here pleasant as can be! I recommend this property for any of your hotel needs.

Summary Heading: Never clean room people stay loud homeless at the pool
Summary: Never clean room loud homeless at the pool hotel no clean horrible service  Check out early and no refund not good experience 0 start feels not safe at the hotel like they just get whatever people into the hotel no class

I booked and pre-paid for a two-night stay in a standard non-smoking Queen room at the Orange County Airport Travelodge.  We arrived about 9pm and checked in at the front desk, and were directed and given keys to a room, at the rear of the building.  We drove around, got armfuls of stuff, and swiped ourselves into the room – only to find it occupied by three people, who slammed the door in our face. Apparently no staff had noticed that the room had been neither cleaned nor vacated.  We put our stuff back in the car, drove back to the front desk, and asked WTF?  The receptionist said something like “oh they never paid for today”, and gave us keys to a different room, which was a room with two double beds, instead of a queen.  But at least there were no other guests in it.  The

Terrible, terrible, terrible. Waste of money.  Can't believe the majority of the staff is in customer service, nevertheless deals with people inn any way shape or form.  Rooms were aweful, incredibly dirty, over-ridden with cockroaches

Summary Heading: Cigarette smoke smell in “supposed”non smoking room!
Summary: My husband and I came here for our 24th anniversary, which we booked in advance as a non smoking room. We both have severe asthma and it was obvious that smoking had been done in the room. The toilets were not wiped down clean and the carpets were filthy. I tried to turn on the air conditioner to get rid of the smoke smell thinking it would help, but it made it worse! I even brought my own disinfectant spray, sprayed down the room, and wiped everything down but it still smelled of cigarettes. In turn that caused mine and my husbands asthma to flare up. So I tried to open the window to air out the room, and not 5 minutes later someone was smoking right outside our window, even though there are signs saying “no smoking within a 25 foot radius”. Needless to say my anniversary was

The room is acceptable. The towels in the room are thin and will not wipe the moisture after shower  But the real surprise for me was the sign in the dining room saying that "due to the shoftage of food some items will not be available" So today no eggs no sausage. Really???

DISGUSTING doesn’t fully describe the level of filth. After seeing what looks to be semen ejaculant, we immediately left the room, went the front desk and asked for a refund. They offered us another room, but after my wife and daughter saw what they saw, there was no way we would ever stay there again. The hotel refused to give refund. I hate them for taking our money and traumatizing my family!

Motel is older but the fridge, microwave & TV all worked. The beds were comfortable, the room was clean and the staff was pleasant. The location is convenient to restaurants and Activities. The air conditioner was working well and the controls were in our room. Parking was sufficient

Summary Heading: new owners are cheap as hell
Summary: Everything has changed since new Indian owners have taken over this Hotel. towel are now old and limited, bathroom paper is very poor, tissue mostly don't exist, pool at time needs cleaning -gets very cloudy, the breakfast was great at one point now the pancake machine and juice don't work, the bananas are almost black, the oranges are gone, the yogurt is gone.  Many days there are no coffee lids. Much of the quality staff has moved on!  The prior staff was excellent and very kind and helpful.  Wyndham Hotels  should be ashamed how the name is being tarnished.  PLUS prices have been raised by 50% and you get 50% less!  Shame on this new owner!  Owner's have not ruined the excellent internet connection and Smart TV! Would not surprised to see that next!

Overall a good stay. I could get picky about some minor details but am happy everything worked properly in the room & I slept well for 3 nights. Staff are helpful, location is convenient, pool & jacuzzi are fantastic & I will definitely stay here again. Much quieter than expected being close to an airport.

Great location for being near airport but that's where it ends. Old and needs remodeling. Carpet in room dirty and only given 1 washcloth and 1 hand towel daily. Staff does a good job with what they have to work with.

I love this place. I've been staying on and off for over 3 years now and it has never let me down. The rooms are spacious and clean. Housekeeping is also very good at cleaning and the Front Desk Staff is always very good in helping with whatever it is you might need. They do offer Hot breakfast instead of the continental breakfast so that was very much appreciated as it allows me to save on breakfast since it is complimentary. They also have a gym, jacuzzi and pool. From what the Front Desk told me. It is serviced 3 times a week so thats pretty awesome. Overall I love this place!

This actually was an amazing motel. The pool was wonderful, location pertainant to where we were going and free breakfast. Great staff from front desk to housekeeping. Just be prepared for airport noise geez the plane taking off every 3 minutes. I know this because I timed it. Turn on the AC it will block the noise.

We enjoyed our stay here.  Excellent value.  Courteous front desk. They were very polite and understanding of getting us connected to Wi Fi, as our business depends on it,  and one of us is Chinese/ESL,  they did not feel bothered like so many other hotels.  Very Clean.  Great breakfast. Will return.

I got bit all over my body! I’m not sure if they are fleas or bedbugs! They left nasty scars all over my legs and feet! There was animal P on the carpet! This is supposed to be a no pet hotel! This is a disgusting fleabag hotel! If you have children you should find a different hotel take my word for it I am a diamond member with Wyndham it is a disgusting fleabag hotel!! Horrifying! Those scars are from this nasty place! I was in disgusting room 121! Beware people!

Stayed for a 3 and a half weeks . Hotel is at a Very convenient location. Friendly staff. Great for those travelling by themselves...lots of eateries nearby..walking distance. Room facilities  has everything you need. Enjoyed the pool But pls fix the lounge chairs..

Run down and things like the ac and refrigerator didnt work. So if you want a rundown room and no service but a great breakfast, you found the right place. Please look else where. Maybe they will get their stuff together but not this time.

This hotel is great!  Not only is the location great (we walked to most of our travel excursions) but the room is nice, roomy, great staff, and the car was parked right down stairs under a covered parking lot! I highly recommend this hotel!

I based my reservation on the reviews here, so I have to post. In no way was this motel acceptable. Maybe because they put me in a room around the back, but it was unsafe and very dated and very dirty. I had to cancel the reservation within a few minutes. Thankfully the girl at the front counter did not give me a hard time.

Nice lobby with business center, car rental service,vending machines along with a super friendly staff.. Samantha and Juan!! In rooms basic stuff,shampoo etc but has safe, good tv, nice size room, very clean, ironing board,luggage rack for a great price. Pool with BBQ, tables & chairs,loungers. There is a good restaurant right next door but many places to choose right across the street. Free shuttle to airport and Suncoast mall. I have to say you feel like your stay matters to staff. They gave a beyond a late check-out and I ask if I could enjoy the pool area after checking out for an hour before my flight and No Problem was their answer. A true Gem!!

Summary Heading: Everything I Needed and Nothing I Didnt
Summary: Rooms are well-appointed with everything I needed. Bed was super comfy. I requested a quiet location and was very happy with the room in back of complex. Room was clean and recently updated. Staff was friendly and helpful. This place was a bargain for SoCal. Highly recommended for budge-minded travelers.

We very much enjoyed our two night stay at this Travelodge. The room was fresh and clean with perfect working air conditions. The bed was comfortable and the sofa a pleasant place to relax and watch television. Loved the beautiful lighting on the palm trees 🌴 around the pool.

Summary Heading: Very good affordable and safe place
Summary: Very good affordable and safe place for business or short vacations. I booked this to attend a course nearby which was close. Couple good fast food places across the street including Starbucks makes it a convenient place.

The sink was clogged, there were lots of little flies in the room, also the jacuzzi was out of order. I felt lots of people in the breakfast room were not hotel guests. Easy to park the car and close to the restaurants

When I went there, I got warm greeting, especially in breakfast room. People there are very kind. That is  my first time in US. The breakfast provides fresh fruit juice, bread and barbecue. I enjoyed it.

Very thin walls and loud airplane noises. The bed made me feel itchy and cleanliness of the room was just average. The bath had issues draining so water would pool at your feet while you showered. Not very impressive.

Decent room for the price.  However, could update the electric outlets to make room functional better.  Also, bath's walls needed to be retiled because it is old and need a thorough cleaning.  Breakfast is good with make your own pancakes, bagels, egg & sausage patties, yogurts, juices, etc.  Stayed on ground floor but will stay upstairs next time because you can hear heavy footsteps and voices directly from room above.  Overall, it's a decent place to stay for a nite or 2.

good value, excellent location, if you need to stay in Orange county near the airport or shopping areas, this is a very good spot to stay. Near almost everything you need and clean well maintained rooms.

We stayed for just a night and it was fine. The bed is a bit small for 6' people, but doable for a night, especially if you don't have to share it. My only gripe was that I went to get ice and the bucket was full of the last guests' coffee garbage. Housekeeping must not have checked. The airport is close and the planes are kind of noisy, but they stop at night. The air conditioner is pretty loud, but that doesn't really bother us The pool is nice and there are plenty of places to eat nearby. The breakfast room was packed and not set up very well. We grabbed a few things and took them back to our room.  This place was adequate and priced pretty well for a short stay.

Summary Heading: Two Star Hotel for a reason
Summary: One step into the lobby and you realize that the property is dated. Rooms are no different; fully equipped with older furniture, dated paint and carpet with a tired bath. The beds while old, were comfy enough. The free WiFi worked one day and then the next it was spotty. Updated to a large screen TV, so that was nice. The pool and hot tub got some use while I was here. Passed by the free breakfast, so no feedback on that other than it exists. There may have been a working girls here, but not in your face; this is not the type of thing to bother me and unless you’re paying attention you wouldn’t know. Quiet and conveniently close, so fit my needs. Cost somewhat reflects the expectations for the quality in the area. Would I stay here again? Yes. Very utilitarian, but not bad for

Motion sensors in sleeping areas that trip when rolling over in bed do not lead to a good night's sleep. Offering shuttle service that is not available does not lead to satisfied guests. Housekeeping knocking at 8:25, after a terrible night's sleep, does not lead to return visits. Non-smoking rooms that smell of smoke is not a comforting environment.

I had a very bad experience. It was horrible. My daughters and I got alot of flee bites and the lights kept going on throughout the night. We all could not sleep. We could not wait to be gone from there.

The hotel has been refurbished. Our room was clean, breakfast was ready early in the morning and is free, the room was clean and fresh when we returned from our afternoon of sightseeing. And the location is perfect. Close to the airport, and just a few miles from all the places we were going to be visiting during our 3 day stay. And the price was exceptionally right!! Will definitely stay there again.

I travel a lot and this hotel is fantastic! The guest rooms are SO quiet, they are actually soundproofed so you can't hear any noise at all. The linens are top quality and the bed is very comfortable. It's the first hotel I have stayed in where the guest rooms have wooden floors! They rooms are nicely decorated and the staff is the best. The Silver Trumpet Restaurant is a top notch restaurant too. You will have one of the best nights of sleep at The Avenue of the Arts, guaranteed!

It’s a nice place and it’s close to the airport, freeway and other places. Breakfast is really good (pancakes, bread, eggs, sausages). The room was big and everything was clean.  Housekeeper was nice and the pool looks good but it was to cold outside

Pretty nice place. Staff was kind. Breakfast was ok. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable. Everything worked and there was room for the roll away . Parking was good and the outside was well kept .

This started out with not getting the room I reserved - 2 beds.  This was corrected, so it was just a minor inconvenience.  BUT THIS WAS NOT!   The door to my room was opened from the outside at 2 AM!  Luckily I had flipped the metal bar lock.  Called the front desk and they could not tell me why and offered no concern or empathy.  Needless to say it was a sleepless night.  Oh - I am a women who was traveling with my son who has anxiety.  THIS WAS NOT OKAY

I needed to find a hotel for an overnight stay during a weekend bicycle trip, and this location was perfect for our group. There were many choices for eating all within walking distance. The staff was very friendly and helpful with our questions. The only negative thing I would say is the breakfast wasn't as good as I thought it should have been.

Summary Heading: Thought being a Wyndham Hotel it would be good....very sad..Like a motel but higher price
Summary: Terrible property....not  Ike the pics...Breakfast does not have anything like pics....very uncomfortable bed..sad They must think guests are stupid...Wyndham has done nothing I checking standards Cold boiled eggs....are they kidding .

Summary Heading: BEWARE don't stay at this hotel
Summary: Terrible place to stay.  It is adjacent to the airport take off and landing.  You will not sleep past 7 a.m. as that is when the planes take off and you won't get any rest during the day as the plane noise is absolutely horrible.

The room was very well equipped. They have staff that also speaks Spanish and we enjoyed the free breakfast service. It located close to the UC Irvine, where my son moves in as freshman. The hotel is close to many restaurant and 7-eleven store.

Summary Heading: If you are in a bind, stay here
Summary: My daughter and I needed a room close to the airport so we chose this. The area is not a bad area of town. Food places all around. The layout of the motel is weird. We had a room by the pool and had to park on the opposite side of the complex and walk through the lobby. Would be nice if there was parking all around. There was a family at the pool cooking and swimming until late and they were loud. The walls are defiantly thin. We were also two doors down from the breakfast room and that brought lots of noise early in the morning. The motel is definitely in the flight path for the airport because every 5-10 minutes we could hear a plane fly overhead. The motel is in need of updating. Everything is worn and does not look clean. I'm sure it is clean but due to the wear and tear, it

I'll start by saying the room was spacious and clean; breakfast and parking were great.  The location is very close to the airport, freeway and restaurants (The Acapulco down the street is wonderful). We booked 3 nights, but unfortunately we felt it best to check out after 2 nights due to noise both in the room above and right outside our door at the pool and hot tub.  From the room above we heard every step, jumps off the beds, running around, etc.  Our ceiling creaked loudly with each movement...the same group ran up and down the stairs and was partying at the pool all night and it was frustrating, so we called the Front Desk around 1:00am the first night and 2:00am the next. I know it's tough to control guests who are determined to be rowdy and loud; however it was impossible

This was my first time staying at this property. My employer was tightening up on lodging per deim this year.  In the past I was booked into a larger, more expensive property nearby so I was a bit concerned about my first-time stay @ this location. But I have to say it was a very positive 4 nights stay and I would repeat the booking if I am in the area in the future. The staff were all professional, the rooms were clean and the price was within my allotted budget.

Overall, it was much better than I had expected.  The location is great.  The breakfast more than adequate.  All was good.  The location is next to a Freeway interchange, so getting around is perfect.  There is a service station, fast food, convenience store (with a no fee ATM )and restaurant all just across the street.

Summary Heading: GREAT value, CLEAN, friendly staff, GREAT food
Summary: Stayed here for a week and was very happy with our choice. The staff was amazing, friendly, VERY helpful. The room was very clean and the breakfast was awesome. We enjoyed the spa every night. Location is near lots of things and we found it easy to navigate to Newport and Huntington Beaches from there. Our only complaints were actually pretty minor - the room had automatic lights that came on at night when one of us got up (easily fixed with some tape over the electric eye, suggested by the amazing staff) and the toilet paper holder was 11.5" from the floor (we measured...). No one on the amazing staff had an explanation for it and were as perplexed as we were... Made for good conversation.

Summary Heading: This trip disappointed us, never had a bad experience at Travelodge until now.
Summary: We very rarely leave such negative reviews, but our experience was bad.  We would not recommend this hotel.  It was old (outdated unlike the pictures online), dirty (shower, floors/carpets), and the bed was ridiculously uncomfortable.  The guests next door were loud and stayed up past midnight.  We were visiting for a work trip and incredibly disappointed.   We were also hoping for a better breakfast selection, it was served in converted hotel rooms with limited space.  We will NOT be returning to this Travelodge.

Summary Heading: This was a 5* for a 2* hotel
Summary: Clean room, comfortable bed, decent size and upgraded countertops and bathroom. Didn't use the pool but it looked clean. Staff were excellent. Let us check in early. Breakfast was a typical continental: bagels/toast, yogurt, fruit, cereal, coffee, and they added eggs & sausage along with a pancake maker that I am not sure worked since no one was using it.   The only cons had to do with noise. The convenience of being close to the airport also comes with an extremely loud noise from the airplanes overhead. Thankfully the curfew kept us from being up all night but it was surprisingly loud.
This place was great, we got upgraded for free and the front desk lady was fantastic. Lots of places to go in the area (walking Distance). We will be going back.

The staff were very pleasant and very happy to help, they made our stay very easy.  The rooms were basic but adequate enough, although the water pressure in the shower was a little low.  The bed was very comfortable and the room was very clean.  The breakfast room was nice and had a pancake maker, which was a bit of a novelty!

Summary Heading: Average - a little overpriced for the over condition
Summary: Just okay. The bed was uncomfortable and room service was in a big hurry to get in and clean. Did appreciate feeling rushed at 8am. Bathroom tub had rust spots.

Old motel with a need for new carpet. Otherwise the room was ok but in need of an update. The WiFi was also not very good. We did not try the breakfast. The location was great however if you need to catch an early flight from John Wayne or find a place to eat. I would stay in this area again but find a different motel.

Don’t expect much. It is a motel. The room of clean but carpets felt dingy and I didn’t dare walk barefoot on it. The thing that bothered me most was that the shower head had some build up on it and hadn’t been cleaned before I got there. There was mold on the tub faucets so that was super gross. At first I thought there was construction in the building but it turns out the water pipes bang on the walls when someone turns on the faucets! What I especially didn’t like was that you can smell cigarette smoke when the whole place was supposed to be a no smoking area. There should be a designated area for smokers away from the windows and doors. However, the service was great and the people at the front desk very helpful.

Summary Heading: Cust Serv is excellent. All staff is very pleasent and...
Summary: Cust Serv is excellent. All staff is very pleasent and everytime I come to stay they always greet me with a smile and make sure that all of my needs are taken care of.

Greeted by friendly staff in a very nice lobby.  The room was clean, carpet on the newer side.  Bed very hard, short on pillows.  Bath has new granite counter but very old pitted fixtures.  Tub in poor repair.  Shower was miserable; water cycled from cool to unbearably hot.  Enjoyed the Jacuzzi and mid Feb. Sunshine by the pool.  For a $100 a night could be better but was not awful.

Summary Heading: Clean and safe and close to airport
Summary: I had an early flight from Santa Ana. The hotel is close to the airport and reasonably priced. The property is in good repair and the room was comfortable. I would stay here again.

Summary Heading: Housekeeping wants you out at 10:20 AM, Check-out is 12:00 PM.
Summary: According to my reservation confirmation, Check-Out was 12:00 PM. Housekeeping knocked on my door at 10:20 AM and they were standing outside my door at 10:45 waiting for me to leave.  As soon as I opened the door and started picking up my luggage, one of them rushed in and started cleaning BEFORE I EVEN LEFT!!! Very irritating, I will not recommend a place like this. I've never had this happen anywhere else.

Property very dated and badly in need of an update.  Old style motel with exterior hallway access.  appeared to be more of a "resident" facility than a tourist facility.  Location was difficult to access.

The Hotel was average for the price. We weren’t expecting a 5 Star hotel or even a 3 Star. Just expecting a comfortable bed and a place to shower while we visited friends last minute. The biggest complaint I had was the water in the shower went from scorching hot to ice cold no matter what you did. The beds could really use new pillows. Other than that you are getting what you pay for... a clean hotel with friendly staff and a hot breakfast.

Summary Heading: Nice 4 an overnight stay, if you don't mind them allowing you to stay there!ⁿ or feeling like they"re doing you a favor
Summary: Like the remodeled deluxe bus. king Rooms, breakfast was very good as long as you don't mind the "I'm doing you a favor by letting you stay here attitude" that most 3 star and under properties run by middle eastern people living on property treat their guests, If your looking to enjoy yourself and treat like a guest step it up $20-$30 to where the franchisee family doesn't live on property.

I'm rating this on the fact that the reader will know the difference between a travelodge and a hyatt etc.  Great, friendly serivce when we arrived.  our room was clean, bed was comfortable.  Breakfast was good.  I would stay here again.  neighborhood was fine and safe.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review.   We strive to keep our property to be a welcoming place for all type of travelers.  We offer a good value price that includes services guest need. Pleased to hear you had a good stay at Travelodge O.C. Airport.   management

Summary Heading: Great stay here. It is located at a good spot for visiting Costa Mesa, Irvine and Newport.
Summary: It's about what you would expect from an airport hotel. Outside looks a little dated but the inside of the rooms are clean and rather modern. Comes with a fridge and microwave too for convenience food.
Manager Response: Thank you for your time.   We are close to John Wayne Airport, and offer free shuttle from there  (6:00am to 11:00pm please contact the hotel once at the Airport for pick up) Amenities are included at no extra charge, such as fridge, coffee maker, microwave, hair dryer.  Thank you for your visit.  Management

Summary: Expedia showed this room on the web as non smoking.  Travelodge put us in a smoking room (136). We rejected it then offered another smoking room (147).  We rejected it then a non smoking room (261).  Deceptive practices used here.  Never returning to another Wyndham properties
Manager Response: Thank you for your review.  Please accept our apologies, rooms mentioned are non-smoking. It is the irresponsible actions of some guest that creates this issue when they smoke in our non-smoking rooms. We will inspect these rooms and apply procedure to remove odor.   We appreciate your comments.

Summary: I stay here frequently because it is clean, safe and inexpensive and near places I want to visit.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review.  We appreciate your loyalty. And we are pleased to hear it is a convenient locations for your needs. We strive to maintain our prices within a good rage while providing amenities and good service.   Thank you,  Management

Summary: I was told that check in time was at 3:00pm and I asked if I could check in earlier.  The representative told me to call the day of check in to find out if I would be allowed.  I was able to check in earlier and I really appreciated it.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review.   Our staff is happy to assist our customers and for the most part are able to meet request, Although we are not able to guarantee request we do try our best to meet it. It also makes it easier when the room type is not too specific.   Thank you  Management

Summary: First room we were given smelled of cigarettes. They didn’t have any other similar rooms available, so they upgraded us!  That was nice of them.  But once you’re given a bad room, you can’t shake that feeling that efffects the rest of your stay.  You start noticing things like the stain on the sheets, the chipped floor tile, the oddly placed toilet paper roll (less than a foot off the ground), towels that don’t smell as clean as you think they should, and the sink fixture that sits too far back so you end up splashing water all over the counter just to wash your hands.   For the price, more expensive than Motel 6, I had an experience that was only slightly better than what I’d expect to get at a Motel 6.   I did enjoy the complimentary breakfast though. Simple options, but it
Manager Response: Thank your review.   We apologize for the inconvenience of the first room, Please know it is just as hard for the Hotel to deal with rooms and guest that just don't care and damage/affect hotel property and make it difficult for the next guest. Glad to hear you received an upgrade and had a better stay after. Our Hot breakfast is included and is just right to get your day started. Also the location of the hotel and amenities included make it for a better stay than a motel 6.  Thank you for your comments  Management

Summary: Our one night stay passing through was very relaxing and pleasant. Would not hesitate to stay again
Manager Response: Thank you for your review.  Pleased to hear you could relax at Travelodge O.C. Airport.  We hope to be of service on your next trip.   Management

Summary: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay.  The bed was very comfortable. The breakfast was good.   We would stay again. It was very centrally located for us.
Manager Response: Thank you,   We are Happy to hear Travelodge O.C. Airport was a good place to stay for your Family weeding needs. Location is great close to many freeways, South Coast Plaza mall and John Wayne Airport.   management

Summary Heading: Business with pleasure thanks to Travelodge
Summary: I stayed here last year for a family vacation so when I had to come to Orange County for business I did not hesitate to book at this Travelodge.  Great location, clean, GREAT pool and jacuzzi.  I will definitely be back!
Manager Response: Thank you for your review.   We appreciate you returning to stay with us, Glad to hear our hotel is convenient weather it is  for work or pleasure. Our staff strives to keep our property clean and comfortable for each and every guest.   Management

Summary: I liked the room and loved the location but the room clearly reaked of smoke even thought it was a "non smoking room".  My clothes smelled like smoke when I got home.  Other than that, I would return .  but because of the smell I will have to pass on this location in the future.

Stayed here from Sept. 29 to Oct. 8. Good location, clean room and bath. Breakfast average but does include sausage but no sweets. A slight issue at check-in as I reserved a walk-in shower online but got a regular room with tub. Luckily, roll-in shower room was available and was moved. Also, the parking lot was repaved the day we checked out requiring me to move the car and hand carry my luggage thru the lobby to my car. Notice was given but only the night before.  Internet was unusually slow for a motel. All employees were very pleasant to deal with.

The grounds are in decent shape...  Front desk- service was great always friendly and helpful...  Breakfast- was good, but could use a bacon day instead of the sausages everyday kinda deal... Our room- was in poor shape... As the carpet was very old and musty and buckled in places, we had burned out lightbulbs that we told front desk and never were replaced... Could not get it to even out to warm so one moment you would be burned and the next frozen...  Sink had no stopper and the smell of stale sewer water was present.  The door had to be jiggled to be set in lock position and we had the smell of marijuana

Summary Heading: Love this place. The staff is amazing!!
Summary: Samantha the woman at the front desk was so helpful. Customer service is 💯✔ here.. They have kids pool toys in the pool area. They have an amazing breakfast!!It is extremely clean and the maids do a wonderful job. Above all there customer service is 💯 amazing!! I would recommend this hotel to anyone..
We book these room for family vacation. We went to disneyland and we had points and these room was avilable and it was very good and clean.
Room was great, the restroom was clean, had a hard time getting on the wifi though. But overall, great experience.

This hotel is average or below average. The people are generally dumpy and the facilities are nothing to write home about. You get what you pay for, or a little less that what you pay for in this instance.

Friendly customer service at the front desk.  Nice lobby and clean establishment in a quiet area with ample parking and complimentary breakfast.  Pricing is reasonable.
I have stayed here many times and I like it very much! Nice people, nice location and great motel! I have recommended this motel to several of my friends, and some of them have stayed there!

Exactly as advertised - clean, tidy, just what what I needed, a place to lay my head in peace and comfort without any unnecessary frills. Desk staff was great - courteous, professional, made me feel welcome. Would stay again.
Registration lady very nice and hellful recommmending a restaurant in the are. There was a huge roach in the bathroom in the middle of the night. The room could have been cleaner.

Dirty and in disrepair - the bathtub had been recoated and the hardware was coated over.  Rust was coming through the coating.  The carpet was filthy.  The amount of noise from other rooms indicated terrible noise mitigation.  A couple people were smoking pot in the parking lot.
The room was clean and comfortable.  They are still renovating so there's a lot of noise beginning in the morning, but not too early.

All good. Amenities, nice pool and jacuzzi. Some low life-rs smoking weed on the stairs (very young people) and wouldn't move out of way to allow the use of stairs. Left their trash onstairs on purpose to prove they were low level humans. But cannot seem to get away from that around airport properties.

The room and furniture were old and didn't look like clean. The hair dryer was broken and couldn't be stopped without pulling out the plug, I didn't report it as long as it could work. There wasn't enough water pressure in the shower as well. The wall was paper thin and you could hear everything happening outside, and the internet was very poor and unstable. However, the location was convenient and close to the convention I was attending. The only thing appreciated was the continental breakfast despite the lack of available seating.

Summary Heading: Great place, needs a little change
Summary: I stayed at the Travelodge OC from une 29th to Aug 9th, and my first couple nights I was in a end room in the back, had no problem with the location, except the ceiling was cracking and molded in the bathroom from a obvious water leak above. The manager, Cynthia, addressed it and moved me to another room that had been remodeled the previous year. And it was actually a deluxe, but she charged me the same price as before. More then enough to remedy the situation. The next room was pleasent and very comfortable, with 1 exception. The lights are all motion activated, which is a tad frustrating when you turn over in the bed and the room lights come on in the middle of the night. Summary Heading: Our room was nice it was one of their remodeled rooms in...
Summary: Our room was nice it was one of their remodeled rooms in the hotel.  I didn't like the fact that there wasn't a separate closet area ,the closet was right in the bathroom  by the sink.  The pool pump in the swimming pool went down so the pool was starting to get dusky looking.  I wish there was a source of good protein for the breakfast   Besides those ready-made egg pancakes  that were warmed up in the microwave and then put it in the warmer     The staff was very friendly and accommodating.  Internet connection was awful it was all Wi-Fi and it was really bad I wish they had a hardwired connection in the rooms as well.  The room was very clean.  I stayed with my whole family and it was nice having two connecting rooms.  overall it wasn't a bad stay for the money

Summary Heading: The rooms were dirty.  The shower was HORRIBLE and the...
Summary: The rooms were dirty.  The shower was HORRIBLE and the temperature of the water could be adjusted to either scalding hot or ice cold...no in between.  We checked out after one night and they billed us for 5,  will not return.
Great place! I was impressed with the friendliness of the staff. They had shuttles to the airport, shopping etc. This was bonus as I did not even need to uber places. Wonderful experience !!

Summary Heading: Could be better. Seems rooms are older and dark. Beds were...
Summary: Could be better. Seems rooms are older and dark. Beds were hard and uncomfortable. No 1st floor available which was tough for someone with bad knee. No iron in room had to get at front desk.

Summary Heading: Good spot close to John Wayne airport and segerstrom hall
Summary: It was fine as to location and quiet when planes not flying.  We especially appreciated the restaurant next door, "POM and OIL"  A very reasonably priced  meditterrannean  tyoe with many wonderful choices of food.  Service was excellent and it is right next to thehhotel  eanian

Fast easy check in. Decent size room and spacious, nice and clean. Bathroom was small but clean as well. Tv , Mini fridge, micro & AC worked. Good phone service. Clean bedding and sheets. Wifi worked great. Carpeting in room was in good shape. Nice big parking lot located at property with plenty of parking. Helpful friendly staff. Nice big tv. Great channel selection. Great water pressure in shower and clean towels. Housekeeping was fantastic.Room had a very comfy and cozy feel to it. Was a quiet stay. Lights had censors and timers. No elevator. Location was pretty good, there were many local fast food options for a quick bite.

The accommodations were basically a place to rest, close to eating locations and freeway.  However, the thiin walls did not block out the noise of the upstairs neighbors and incoming visitors.  We could not operate the television system.

Summary Heading: A step or two above a flophouse
Summary: I do not want to bring any negative feedback against the staff, who was great. However, the facility itself is not what I expected and needs so maintenance and refreshing.
This Travelodge was the most upscale one I have stayed in.  My room was beautiful and modern and fully equiped.  The facility was immaculate and the breakfast top notch!!!

The place is very nice nice and cozy it is Good for getting away from the City and closer to the beach, the neighborhood seems very safe with lots of foodplaces across the Road. Definetly recommend for families, not so much for Young people who Are seeking parties and loudness.

Easy friendly check-in. Clean room. Rug, furniture and bathroom could use some freshening up. The free breakfast had a variety of nice selections including fresh hot pancakes! Only negative was the noisy AC unit.

This is a close, relatively inexpensive, clean, comfortable place to stay while at the Clinic. Courtesy mini van service between the airport, and the Clinic is provided. Only challenge was waiting 47 minutes to be picked up from the clinic, one day, 30 min the next, and 10 minutes the final day.  I loved swimming in the outdoor pool !  Genesis grill at poolside for guests to use. No elevator to 2nd floor. Friendly staff. Breakfast could be improved. High carb offerings prevailed. I do not like Yoplait brand yogurt. Greek yogurt would be an improvement. Small coffee cups. Pre cooked eggs left a lot to be desired. Sausage patty and links were good. I would rather have warm hard boiled eggs available !
We really enjoyed our stay, we were recommended by some friends to stay here. We loved the girls at the front desk. Always cheerful and helpful.

The facility was clean, hotel staff was nice and able to assist with any additional items needed for the room.  The hotel provided a really good breakfast there was always someone there to make sure breakfast items were stocked.  The only problem we encountered was the person that was above us was up all hours of the night stomping (not walking) back and forth.  The hotel manager was apologetic and we we're appreciative of what she was able offer us.  We would stay there again..

Summary Heading: Not 5 star, but had an excellent stay.
Summary: Spent less than 12 hours here in between connection flights. Arrived at SNA after the shuttle driver was off for the night so the hotel graciously reimbursed me for the taxi, with receipt from taxi driver! Very impressed. 2 miles from airport, very convenient.  Room is clean and very decent. I'm a 40 year old female and I felt safe alone on the property. Lots of nextdoor noise like thumps and elephants walking lol and water pipes noise from above but, whatever. Air conditioner worked awesome in room 110.  Pool area is nice altho I didn't use it I checked it out and it's clean and has decent shade.  Free "continental" breakfast was really great! Sausage patties, links, egg rounds, cereal and milk, coffee, juice, pancake maker (fun and yummy!), breads, English muffins, yogurt,

Summary Heading: Very nice Travelodge, close to the airport
Summary: This property was the nicest example of the franchise I have stayed in. Clean, well-decorated and a courteous and helpful staff. Recommended.

''Twas the best stay ever, I was scared that because the price was a bit low that it was a run down place but WOW was I wrong. SUPER WRONG.  There was a tiny problem that honestly I could've taken care of myself but I called the manager to ask him if he could take care of it and he even refunded me some money for the inconvenience so that was another plus. The staff was super friendly and personable. Was an amazing stay. Bathrooms were super updated and clean as well as the whole room and free cable and fridge &  a microwave too. Extra blankets were already there by the closet. It was just really great and they supply pool toys for kids it was just great over all thank you travelodge!
The room was ok, the mattress was hard and there wasn't enough pillows and blankets for me and my husband.

Summary Heading: Wanted to spend a couple days at the beach, and this was...
Summary: Wanted to spend a couple days at the beach, and this was the perfect location and price. Staff was very Friendly and Clean! Will definitely stay again. A little loud in the morning with people going to the breakfast room, but overall good, very happy with our stay.

Ok, I stayed here last year and I was pleased with a refurbished room and helpful staff at a great price.  So I felt comfortable having my wife stay here when she visited California (normally I would have paid a little more for a Fairfield Inn or something like that).  But apparently not all the rooms are refurbished -- her's did not at all resemble mine, and it smelled of urine.  The put her on the second floor, and apparently there is not elevator, so she had to lug her luggage up the stairs (I didn't realize this as I had stayed on the first floor). Also, the breakfast was very minimal.

The hotel is very close to the airport, but the noise was coming from other guests.  The walls must be very thin, because I heard way too much.  There was also a spider in the shower.  He had been there quite a while.  The property is need of an update.  The lady serving breakfast was awesome.  She turned a terrible stay into a poor stay.

They say you get what you pay for... and what you aren't paying for at this Travelodge is sound dampening.  All night long you can hear the snoring of those in adjacent rooms, the clomping of people walking outside, whatever is happening in other bathrooms through the vent in your own bathroom.  The list goes on.  If you are a heavy sleeper this likely isn't an issue, but the constant noise of other guests and employees did not lend itself to a good night's sleep for me.  On the plus side, there is laundry on site and the room was decent.  There is a continental breakfast, though the options were few and not fantastic.  Parking fills up quickly, so we weren't always parked close to our room.
I enjoyed my stay and liked the property. The only drawback is there were a few prostitutes in and out of the property.
overall it was fine specially the cleaning ladies are very polite and helpful always with a smile,

Travelodge is one of those brands that you really can't (or shouldn't) get too upset if there's not a mint on your pillow and your towels aren't folded into origami swans. They're not a premium brand, and if you get an affordable room without crumbs in between the sheets, that's pretty much what they're there for. I stay at premium brand hotels and boutiques fairly often - so when the occasion is better suited by affordability than luxury, I try not to be too judge-y.  All of that is to say that this is an *exceptional* Travelodge. The lobby was probably the cutest of any I've been in - and designed to feel more like a "Hotel" than a motel. Here's my breakdown:  1. Room cleaning was incomplete without pointing out to the cleaning lady discrepancies. Breakfast room was tidy & well serviced.

The Travelodge OC Airport/ Costa Mesa, was a very very pleasant stay, bed was comfortable, bathroom was a little small but clean and nice. Only had problems with the tv remote, and a stain on the couch.  ac and heater worked well and there was a fridge, thats always a plus! Would come back anytime. Also, if they had dimmers for the LEDs would be a nice addition as they all turn on and are extremely bright, not a bad thing, unless you wanna have lights on but not too bright.
The value is good and the re-modeled units are the only ones I will stay in. The breakfast is decent, actually quite good for free. Pool area and appearance very good.

HOUSEKEEPING SHOULD BE BETTER  THE CONTINUE TO KNOCK ON MY DOOR TO EARLY.. English is not requires..breakfast was decent  Front desk fair and helpfully. They  don't have shades so the room is always Dark. can't enjoy looking  Out the window

For the price this was exactly what we wanted...ease of getting around, to the beach, restaurants, airport and our rental car. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable. Not all patrons were great but we didn't have a problem sleeping. The only thing I can say negatively was the wifi was not great but not bad enough to complain

I stayed here for a conference held at the Westin about a mile and a half away. Check-in was a breeze and the attendant was very friendly. I spent less on three nights total here than the other attendees for my conference spent on one night at the Westin. It's super quiet-close to the freeway and I felt safe checking in late at night solo. The room had a table and chairs, a separate desk and chair, tv with HBO, microwave, fridge, iron, ironing board, hairdryer, toiletries, coffee maker w/coffee, and the housekeeper folds the washcloths into cute ruffles. It's very clean-no complaints in that department. I haven't tried the free breakfast but it's there. The parking and wifi are free as well. Summary Heading: This Travel Lodge is in a good, central, fairly easy to...
Summary: This Travel Lodge is in a good, central, fairly easy to find location, with  pleasant staff, nice grounds, a clean pool and hot tub area and ample breakfast room/buffet, however, the bed was the WORST we've ever slept in, thus we will neither return nor recommend it!
Our room was clean and comfortable, large TV screen, good breakfast, decent coffee and even though its near the OC Airport, the planes don't fly from 10pm until 7am.  Good sleepin'....
Enjoying grandkids all day, I just needed a clean, safe place to sleep and this Travelodge was perfect.

Good rate for a no frills, comfy room, with a nice pool and great Breakfast Room options. My mom especially loved the pancake maker. The room needed to be aired out better before we arrived, but to be fair they originally had us in the 2nd floor and my mom requested the ground floor at check in, so they were trying to be accommodating. The only other noticeable thing was every now and then a small plane would fly overhead making conversation impossible for a moment. All-in-all a great value for the weary traveler not looking for excessive luxury.

We have stayed at this hotel many times over the past two years.  The newly remodeled rooms are very nice.  The staff is always friendly  and helpful.  It's also nice to have a shuttle to and from the nearby airport.

The stay at the Travelodge Orange County Airport/Costa Mesa was satisfactory. I booked it because it was inexpensive, and was booked as a place to clean up and sleep for a few hours. The beds could have used more blankets, and the bathroom could have been a little cleaner. It was hard getting the water temperature to work correctly when showering. I believe the rooms could use some updating for sure.

Summary Heading: Overall it wasn't bad for the price. Room smelled bad. The...
Summary: Overall it wasn't bad for the price. Room smelled bad. The hot water took about 5 minutes to finally come out of faucet and shower. Our room had a coffee pot but no coffee or fixings. The pool/jacuzzi was nice. The continental breakfast was over average.

The hotel was clean, the room comfortable, and the internet connection was fast and reliable. The location was very convenient to the airport. The breakfast offered some unusual options, including the ability to make a breakfast sandwich with a sausage patty and an egg patty. Overall, I was very satisfied with the hotel, especially in view of the reasonable price.

Summary Heading: When I called I was told hotel was 15 minutes from USC...
Summary: When I called I was told hotel was 15 minutes from USC campus. Hotel was great, but we were 45 miles from campus. I would recommend hotel but advise people to check distance from hotel to where they are going themselves.

I was picked up by shuttle at John Wayne airport...about a 20 minute wait in the sunshine... didn't mind at all as I was coming from a winter storm. Arrived at 2pm, an hour before check-in time, and they were kindly able to accommodate me right away, in an updated room...I had requested 2 beds, but no longer needed them, so I ended up in a nicer room with one bed and a pull-out sofa. My room was close to the lobby, the pool, and the breakfast room. The bed was very comfortable.  Was it a little noisy? Sure...you can hear airplanes, you can hear through the walls, and you can hear pool noise. Did I particularly care? Not really. I'm always prepared with ear plugs when I travel, and I know what to expect when I'm paying lower rates. There are many places to eat nearby, so you

This place needs an update.  Beds and bedding looked old.  There were nats everywhere on the outside of our door and when we opened the door to the room they all went inside.  We spent the next hour trying to kill them all.  Carpets were dirty also.  Just gross!

The staff at this hotel were very friendly and ready to help with all our requests. We stayed here 3 times over a 2 week period for a family visit. The desk had no problem with our last minute changes. Like many travelers, we forgot several toiletries. The desk had supplies and on hand and helped us out several times. My wife has health issues and needs her head elevated when sleeping. The service staff provided extra pillows and waited to ensure she would be comfortable. My only real issue with this hotel is the WiFi. It is 11g which is very slow by today's standards. Enjoyed the stay and will stay here again when traveling.
Beds a bit hard but at least not sagging in the middle. Overall not a bad place, it is in the flight path of the airport so you can hear the planes taking off.

All we needed was a clean and comfortable place to sleep before attending admitted student day at UC Irvine.  Location was convenient to John Wayne Airport, having dinner near South Coast Plaza, and the next morning for driving to UC Irvine.  Our only complaint was that they only gave us one washcloth.  As we were getting ready in the morning, we noticed a lot of airplane noise, but it wasn't an issue at night and did not disturb us at all.  Breakfast was fine and staff in the breakfast room was very nice and helpful, as was the person working the front desk when we arrived around 9pm
Manager Response: Thank you for your review,  We apologize about insufficient towels, there are usually some placed as decoration next to sink area which may be used as well.   Please know the front desk has extras as well. We are glad to hear it was a convenient location to your needs. Hope to see you as a returning customer.  Thank you  Management

Summary: Nothing to share at this time always check in to different places and hotel mostly getting the bad mood cuz of the hotel quality thru Wyndham....
Manager Response: Thank you for your review,  we will check bathroom ceiling, our apologies. We are continuing to improve/remodel rooms.  Management

Manager Response: Thank you for your review,  Please accept our sincere apology for the inconvenience. Upon check in we ask guest if they want smoking or non, but some people feel its ok to smoke in non-smoking rooms creating this problem. We do our best to air the room out when this happens,    we regret and apologize for your room being overlooked. other concerns will be reviewed with housekeeping. We hope you can give us another chance and we are able to provide better service, please know upon checking in any concerns will be addressed within a timely manner or a different room can be provided when the front desk is notified.   thank you, Management

Summary Heading: Staff lagged on handling disturbance issue
Summary: Our stay had been a pleasant (and quiet) one up until 10:30pm when a group of men decided to turn the pool area into their personal frat house.  Music blared - Dancing amongst each other ensued - All the while drinking.  Things escalated to singing and hollering then leading to throwing chairs, tables, and deck umbrellas into the water.  The fiasco came to a horrifying head when 2 of the men stood at the edge of the pool and urinated into it.    Despite 3 calls from our room and multiples call from other guests (as front desk reported) it took an hour for someone to come out and put an end to the madness. Incredibly too long to get a handle on something this disturbing and illegal - Especially for those distressed guests with children
Manager Response: Thank you for your review,   We apologize for any inconvenience.  front desk/ management do their best at maintaining the peace at our Hotel. We handle each situation with caution to prevent any harm to any guest or staff member. No noise complaint is taken lightly it just sometimes takes longer to get things under control our last resort is to contact the authorities but if need be we do so. Our pool is services twice a week and if needed called for extra service.   thank you,  Management

Summary: Staff was friendly and accomodating.  The room was newly remodeled, lovely, clean and good bed.  The breakfast room was by the pool and wonderful.
We have stayed here before and the rooms are always clean and staff is always very helpful and polite. The beds are very comfortable!

My room (104) was recently updated.  The bed was comfortable and the breakfast was great.  The front desk was friendly and helpful.  This was a great hotel for the price.  I stayed one night and was perfect.
A clean and comfortable motel great value. I recommend the upgraded rooms. Lots of places to eat in 5min walking  or less.
Rooms were a bit old, but other than that, good place with pool and jacuzzi. The breakfast was quite good and the restaurants across the street were nice.
the rooms are very nice especially the ones with the disign near the ceiling.  The nights are very quiet.  No one bohered me at the door.

Summary Heading: Great location however the shower system is terrible.  The...
Summary: Great location however the shower system is terrible.  The water gets very hot then very cold on a regular basis.  It stays very hot or cold for several minutes not just a quick change...
The service was excellent and the room was clean and comfy. It would have been nice to have a microwave in the room, but there was one available 24/7 in the office area.

Summary Heading: Great Value, Clean and updated rooms, good breakfast and friendly staff
Summary: Booked this room as I flew into LAX very late and was headed south to North San Diego.  I found this hotel to be a Great Value, with Clean and updated rooms, a good breakfast and friendly staff.
clean comfortable, fully equiped, close to really good Greek and Inka restaurants, free shuttle to and from airport. Staff works hard to please and get you the best price.

Stayed just one night to get a very early flight at John Wayne Airport. The Hotel is very well located, in front of various restaurantes, just 5 minutes from de Airport and the staff is very friendly. The only perhaps is that the room smells not good, because the windows are closed all the time. Internet doesn't`t work the room

Everything was fine except the shower. The hotel is in a very convenient area, room is confortable, good (included) breakfast, but taking a shower was a nightmare. The water temperature changed from warm to boiling every 10 to 15 seconds. I think it's because the room is behind the laundry room and the maintenance room
I was surprised that they served a hot breakfast as part of their complimentary continental breakfast!

I was very impressed with this hotel. It has a nice lobby and I was allowed to check in early, and they required no deposit. The room is very nice and my room had a couch, and a large desk. There was a 60" flat screen television. The bathroom was very nice with good water pressure and hot water. I definately recommend if staying in the Costa Mesa area.

Summary Heading: Good place to stay near John Wayne Airport and South Coast Plaza
Summary: This is an older property. At least some of the rooms have been refurbished. The rear of the property abuts a golf course. Ask for a room on that side to avoid the traffic noise out front. I got in late and left early so I cannot comment on Internet of breakfast.

Summary Heading: A wonderful night of sleep in an immaculate setting.
Summary: I was very happy with the room, the service, and the comfort offered that ensured a rock solid night of sleep.  Will stay there again anytime I'm in the area.
Very convenient to restaurants, airport, and Newport Beach.  Great breakfast room and customer service.

I've stayed at this place a few times now because it is super close to the airport and to the company I do business with in Costa Mesa.  I find the rooms comfortable.  Sure some of them could use a little touch up with paint here and there and some new tiles and grout in the tub area but overall it's a nice place.  Big rooms, very comfy beds (I always sleep well here), nice breakfast and a nice location with plenty of options to walk to for food etc.  Travelodge is not a 5 star hotel chain but if you are looking for a nice, clean, comfortable place to stay that has excellent rates, give this place a try.

Room was OK. My room was way far from the entrance, but I got a discount at least... it was decent for the price. I wish they had an elevator. It was nice they gave me a ride anywhere within 2 miles or so. I loved the bed and pillows - they were not fancy but very comfy! Breakfast eggs were cold and frozen... Staff at the front desk looked mad.

Summary Heading: OC Trip..Was pleasantly surprised.  Nice rooms, great prices and nice free breakfast..Only negative, parking was an issu
Summary: Was pleasantly surpried.Nice room at a great price. Great free breakfast. Only negative was parking problems..Part of the Hotels lot is leased out to a van rental company leaving parking a little tenuios, especially if returning to the hotel late at night.

Summary Heading: large and clean room, friendly staff
Summary: I came by train and the bus stop is just across the street. Very convenient location. There are foods and 7-11 nearby. The staff was friendly and helpful.

We stayed here because we used it as a lay over to and from Mexico. It was relatively inexpensive, had excellent shuttle service, and breakfast. I had never seen a "pancake" machine before. Normally it is a waffle maker. You press a button, batter drops down on a conveyor belt and comes out the end ready to top with butter and syrup. You can push the button more then once so you have several coming out in short order. They also had egg "patties", sausage and the other usual stuff.  The front desk personnel were very quick and friendly. As was the shuttle driver.  There are varied restaurants within walking distance. Bill's Burgers was right on the corner of the parking lot and has much more varied menu then you might expect from a burger joint. The burgers, however, were good.

Summary Heading: Great for a one night stay!
Summary: Great if you are just passing through. Check in was easy and staff was very nice. Thin walls. We heard our neighbors at 1am. We needed a very early taxi around 4:30am because their shuttle service starts at 6. The cab was 20 min late and the front desk was not concerned about us at all. We almost called our own taxi. Other than that it was a pleasant stay. Plenty to eat near by. We left early so we didn't not get the free breakfast. We would come back.
